Title.evidence: Single Ventricle Reconstruction Trial: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: This multicenter randomised controlled trial included 393 participants

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included patients undergoing the Norwood procedure

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either a modified Blalock-Taussig shunt or a right ventricle-to-pulmonary artery shunt

Objective.evidence: The Single Ventricle Reconstruction trial evaluated the impact of shunt type on outcomes

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was hospital length of stay (LOS) at the stage II procedure, measured in days

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence, with allocation concealment ensured by sealed envelopes

Blinding.evidence: Due to the nature of the intervention, blinding was not feasible

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 393 participants were randomised

Number_Analysed.evidence: 196 allocated to the modified Blalock-Taussig shunt and 197 to the right ventricle-to-pulmonary artery shunt

Result_Outcome.evidence: The median stage II procedure hospital LOS was 8 days (IQR 6, 14), with no significant difference between shunt types

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were not significantly different between groups
